fields.description: Optional field to control the assignment behavior  for adding assignments to students' and teachers' calendars when the assignment is published. The possible values are: none, studentsAndPublisher, studentsAndTeamOwners, unknownFutureValue, and studentsOnly. You must use the Prefer: include-unknown-enum-members request header to get the following values in this evolvable enum: studentsOnly. The default value is none.
fields.name: AddToCalendarAction

fields.description: Optional field to control the assignment behavior for students who are added after the assignment is published. If not specified, defaults to none. Supported values are: none, assignIfOpen. For example, a teacher can use assignIfOpen to indicate that an assignment should be assigned to any new student who joins the class while the assignment is still open, and none to indicate that an assignment shouldn't be assigned to new students.
fields.name: AddedStudentAction

fields.description: Identifies whether students can submit after the due date. If this property isn't specified during create, it defaults to true.
fields.name: AllowLateSubmissions

fields.description: Identifies whether students can add their own resources to a submission or if they can only modify resources added by the teacher.
fields.name: AllowStudentsToAddResourcesToSubmission

fields.description: The date when the assignment should become active. If in the future, the assignment isn't shown to the student until this date. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z
fields.name: AssignDateTime

fields.description: Which users, or whole class should receive a submission object once the assignment is published.
fields.name: AssignTo

fields.description: The moment that the assignment was published to students and the assignment shows up on the students timeline. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z
fields.name: AssignedDateTime

fields.description: When set, enables users to easily find assignments of a given type. Read-only. Nullable.
fields.name: Categories

fields.description: Class to which this assignment belongs.
fields.name: ClassId

fields.description: Date when the assignment is closed for submissions. This is an optional field that can be null if the assignment doesn't allowLateSubmissions or when the closeDateTime is the same as the dueDateTime. But if specified, then the closeDateTime must be greater than or equal to the dueDateTime. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z
fields.name: CloseDateTime

fields.description: Who created the assignment.
fields.name: CreatedBy

fields.description: Moment when the assignment was created. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z
fields.name: CreatedDateTime

fields.description: Name of the assignment.
fields.name: DisplayName

fields.description: Date when the students assignment is due. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z
fields.name: DueDateTime

fields.description: Folder URL where all the feedback file resources for this assignment are stored.
fields.name: FeedbackResourcesFolderUrl

fields.description: How the assignment will be graded.
fields.name: Grading

fields.description: When set, enables users to weight assignments differently when computing a class average grade.
fields.name: GradingCategory

fields.description: Instructions for the assignment. The instructions and the display name tell the student what to do.
fields.name: Instructions

fields.description: Who last modified the assignment.
fields.name: LastModifiedBy

fields.description: The date and time on which the assignment was modified. A student submission doesn't modify the assignment; only teachers can update assignments. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time. For example, midnight UTC on Jan 1, 2014 is 2014-01-01T00:00:00Z
fields.name: LastModifiedDateTime

fields.description: The URL of the module from which to access the assignment.
fields.name: ModuleUrl

fields.description: Optional field to specify the URL of the channel to post the assignment publish notification. If not specified or null, defaults to the General channel. This field only applies to assignments where the assignTo value is educationAssignmentClassRecipient. Updating the notificationChannelUrl isn't allowed after the assignment is published.
fields.name: NotificationChannelUrl

fields.description: Learning objects that are associated with this assignment. Only teachers can modify this list. Nullable.
fields.name: Resources

fields.description: Folder URL where all the file resources for this assignment are stored.
fields.name: ResourcesFolderUrl

fields.description: When set, the grading rubric attached to this assignment.
fields.name: Rubric

fields.description: Status of the assignment.  You can't PATCH this value. Possible values are: draft, scheduled, published, assigned, unknownFutureValue, inactive. Note that you must use the Prefer: include-unknown-enum-members request header to get the following value(s) in this evolvable enum: inactive.
fields.name: Status

fields.description: Once published, there's a submission object for each student representing their work and grade. Read-only. Nullable.
fields.name: Submissions

fields.description: The deep link URL for the given assignment.
fields.name: WebUrl
